title: Hexagonal Architecture: Building Maintainable Software
subtitle: Master the Ports and Adapters pattern for testable, flexible applications
description: Master the Ports and Adapters pattern from the ground up. Follow Sam, a solo founder transforming BookShelf from a tangled mess into a clean, testable system. Learn why companies like Netflix and Spotify use this pattern—and how to apply it in your own projects.

author.name: Architecture Academy
author.bio: Our courses are designed by experienced software architects who have built and maintained large-scale systems across industries including fintech, healthcare, and e-commerce.

skills_taught: Implement swappable adapters for different technologies
Write unit tests without mocking infrastructure
target_audience: Backend developers wanting to write more maintainable code
Developers struggling with tightly-coupled legacy systems
Anyone preparing for system design interviews

required: Understanding of interfaces and dependency injection

seo.meta_description: Master Hexagonal Architecture with hands-on examples. Learn ports, adapters, and clean domain design through building a real application.

story.description: Follow Sam, a solo founder who built BookShelf—a digital library management system—quickly to validate the idea. Now with paying customers, investors wanting mobile apps, and enterprises demanding on-premise deployment, Sam must transform a tangled codebase into something maintainable. Hexagonal Architecture becomes the lifeline.
